6582 
6583  private:
6584  template<typename T>
6585  static void add_to_vector(std::vector<uint8_t>& vec, size_t bytes, const T number)
6586  {
6587  assert(bytes == 1 or bytes == 2 or bytes == 4 or bytes == 8);
6588 
6589  switch (bytes)
6590  {
6591  case 8:
6592  {
6593  vec.push_back(static_cast<uint8_t>((number >> 070) & 0xff));
6594  vec.push_back(static_cast<uint8_t>((number >> 060) & 0xff));
6595  vec.push_back(static_cast<uint8_t>((number >> 050) & 0xff));
6596  vec.push_back(static_cast<uint8_t>((number >> 040) & 0xff));
6597  // intentional fall-through
6598  }
6599 
6600  case 4:
6601  {
6602  vec.push_back(static_cast<uint8_t>((number >> 030) & 0xff));
6603  vec.push_back(static_cast<uint8_t>((number >> 020) & 0xff));
6604  // intentional fall-through
6605  }
6606 
6607  case 2:
6608  {
6609  vec.push_back(static_cast<uint8_t>((number >> 010) & 0xff));
6610  // intentional fall-through
6611  }
6612 
6613  case 1:
6614  {
6615  vec.push_back(static_cast<uint8_t>(number & 0xff));
6616  break;
6617  }
6618  }
6619  }
6620 
6657  template<typename T>
6658  static T get_from_vector(const std::vector<uint8_t>& vec, const size_t current_index)
6659  {
6660  if (current_index + sizeof(T) + 1 > vec.size())
6661  {
6662  JSON_THROW(std::out_of_range("cannot read " + std::to_string(sizeof(T)) + " bytes from vector"));
6663  }
6664 
6665  T result;
6666  auto* ptr = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&result);
6667  for (size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(T); ++i)
6668  {
6669  *ptr++ = vec[current_index + sizeof(T) - i];
6670  }
6671  return result;
6672  }
6673 
6684  static void to_msgpack_internal(const basic_json& j, std::vector<uint8_t>& v)
6685  {
6686  switch (j.type())
6687  {
6688  case value_t::null:
6689  {
6690  // nil
6691  v.push_back(0xc0);
6692  break;
6693  }
6694 
6695  case value_t::boolean:
6696  {
6697  // true and false
6698  v.push_back(j.m_value.boolean ? 0xc3 : 0xc2);
6699  break;
6700  }
6701 
6702  case value_t::number_integer:
6703  {
6704  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= 0)
6705  {
6706  // MessagePack does not differentiate between positive
6707  // signed integers and unsigned integers. Therefore, we
6708  // used the code from the value_t::number_unsigned case
6709  // here.
6710  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned < 128)
6711  {
6712  // positive fixnum
6713  add_to_vector(v, 1, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
6714  }
6715  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= UINT8_MAX)
6716  {
6717  // uint 8
6718  v.push_back(0xcc);
6719  add_to_vector(v, 1, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
6720  }
6721  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= UINT16_MAX)
6722  {
6723  // uint 16
6724  v.push_back(0xcd);
6725  add_to_vector(v, 2, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
6726  }
6727  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= UINT32_MAX)
6728  {
6729  // uint 32
6730  v.push_back(0xce);
6731  add_to_vector(v, 4, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
6732  }
6733  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= UINT64_MAX)
6734  {
6735  // uint 64
6736  v.push_back(0xcf);
6737  add_to_vector(v, 8, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
6738  }
6739  }
6740  else
6741  {
6742  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= -32)
6743  {
6744  // negative fixnum
6745  add_to_vector(v, 1, j.m_value.number_integer);
6746  }
6747  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= INT8_MIN and j.m_value.number_integer <= INT8_MAX)
6748  {
6749  // int 8
6750  v.push_back(0xd0);
6751  add_to_vector(v, 1, j.m_value.number_integer);
6752  }
6753  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= INT16_MIN and j.m_value.number_integer <= INT16_MAX)
6754  {
6755  // int 16
6756  v.push_back(0xd1);
6757  add_to_vector(v, 2, j.m_value.number_integer);
6758  }
6759  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= INT32_MIN and j.m_value.number_integer <= INT32_MAX)
6760  {
6761  // int 32
6762  v.push_back(0xd2);
6763  add_to_vector(v, 4, j.m_value.number_integer);
6764  }
6765  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= INT64_MIN and j.m_value.number_integer <= INT64_MAX)
6766  {
6767  // int 64
6768  v.push_back(0xd3);
6769  add_to_vector(v, 8, j.m_value.number_integer);
6770  }
6771  }
6772  break;
6773  }
6774 
6775  case value_t::number_unsigned:
6776  {
6777  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned < 128)
6778  {
6779  // positive fixnum
6780  add_to_vector(v, 1, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
6781  }
6782  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= UINT8_MAX)
6783  {
6784  // uint 8
6785  v.push_back(0xcc);
6786  add_to_vector(v, 1, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
6787  }
6788  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= UINT16_MAX)
6789  {
6790  // uint 16
6791  v.push_back(0xcd);
6792  add_to_vector(v, 2, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
6793  }
6794  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= UINT32_MAX)
6795  {
6796  // uint 32
6797  v.push_back(0xce);
6798  add_to_vector(v, 4, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
6799  }
6800  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= UINT64_MAX)
6801  {
6802  // uint 64
6803  v.push_back(0xcf);
6804  add_to_vector(v, 8, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
6805  }
6806  break;
6807  }
6808 
6809  case value_t::number_float:
6810  {
6811  // float 64
6812  v.push_back(0xcb);
6813  const auto* helper = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(&(j.m_value.number_float));
6814  for (size_t i = 0; i < 8; ++i)
6815  {
6816  v.push_back(helper[7 - i]);
6817  }
6818  break;
6819  }
6820 
6821  case value_t::string:
6822  {
6823  const auto N = j.m_value.string->size();
6824  if (N <= 31)
6825  {
6826  // fixstr
6827  v.push_back(static_cast<uint8_t>(0xa0 | N));
6828  }
6829  else if (N <= 255)
6830  {
6831  // str 8
6832  v.push_back(0xd9);
6833  add_to_vector(v, 1, N);
6834  }
6835  else if (N <= 65535)
6836  {
6837  // str 16
6838  v.push_back(0xda);
6839  add_to_vector(v, 2, N);
6840  }
6841  else if (N <= 4294967295)
6842  {
6843  // str 32
6844  v.push_back(0xdb);
6845  add_to_vector(v, 4, N);
6846  }
6847 
6848  // append string
6849  std::copy(j.m_value.string->begin(), j.m_value.string->end(),
6850  std::back_inserter(v));
6851  break;
6852  }
6853 
6854  case value_t::array:
6855  {
6856  const auto N = j.m_value.array->size();
6857  if (N <= 15)
6858  {
6859  // fixarray
6860  v.push_back(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x90 | N));
6861  }
6862  else if (N <= 0xffff)
6863  {
6864  // array 16
6865  v.push_back(0xdc);
6866  add_to_vector(v, 2, N);
6867  }
6868  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
6869  {
6870  // array 32
6871  v.push_back(0xdd);
6872  add_to_vector(v, 4, N);
6873  }
6874 
6875  // append each element
6876  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.array)
6877  {
6878  to_msgpack_internal(el, v);
6879  }
6880  break;
6881  }
6882 
6883  case value_t::object:
6884  {
6885  const auto N = j.m_value.object->size();
6886  if (N <= 15)
6887  {
6888  // fixmap
6889  v.push_back(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 | (N & 0xf)));
6890  }
6891  else if (N <= 65535)
6892  {
6893  // map 16
6894  v.push_back(0xde);
6895  add_to_vector(v, 2, N);
6896  }
6897  else if (N <= 4294967295)
6898  {
6899  // map 32
6900  v.push_back(0xdf);
6901  add_to_vector(v, 4, N);
6902  }
6903 
6904  // append each element
6905  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.object)
6906  {
6907  to_msgpack_internal(el.first, v);
6908  to_msgpack_internal(el.second, v);
6909  }
6910  break;
6911  }
6912 
6913  default:
6914  {
6915  break;
6916  }
6917  }
6918  }
6919 
6930  static void to_cbor_internal(const basic_json& j, std::vector<uint8_t>& v)
6931  {
6932  switch (j.type())
6933  {
6934  case value_t::null:
6935  {
6936  v.push_back(0xf6);
6937  break;
6938  }
6939 
6940  case value_t::boolean:
6941  {
6942  v.push_back(j.m_value.boolean ? 0xf5 : 0xf4);
6943  break;
6944  }
6945 
6946  case value_t::number_integer:
6947  {
6948  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= 0)
6949  {
6950  // CBOR does not differentiate between positive signed
6951  // integers and unsigned integers. Therefore, we used the
6952  // code from the value_t::number_unsigned case here.
6953  if (j.m_value.number_integer <= 0x17)
6954  {
6955  add_to_vector(v, 1, j.m_value.number_integer);
6956  }
6957  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= UINT8_MAX)
6958  {
6959  v.push_back(0x18);
6960  // one-byte uint8_t
6961  add_to_vector(v, 1, j.m_value.number_integer);
6962  }
6963  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= UINT16_MAX)
6964  {
6965  v.push_back(0x19);
6966  // two-byte uint16_t
6967  add_to_vector(v, 2, j.m_value.number_integer);
6968  }
6969  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= UINT32_MAX)
6970  {
6971  v.push_back(0x1a);
6972  // four-byte uint32_t
6973  add_to_vector(v, 4, j.m_value.number_integer);
6974  }
6975  else
6976  {
6977  v.push_back(0x1b);
6978  // eight-byte uint64_t
6979  add_to_vector(v, 8, j.m_value.number_integer);
6980  }
6981  }
6982  else
6983  {
6984  // The conversions below encode the sign in the first
6985  // byte, and the value is converted to a positive number.
6986  const auto positive_number = -1 - j.m_value.number_integer;
6987  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= -24)
6988  {
6989  v.push_back(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x20 + positive_number));
6990  }
6991  else if (positive_number <= UINT8_MAX)
6992  {
6993  // int 8
6994  v.push_back(0x38);
6995  add_to_vector(v, 1, positive_number);
6996  }
6997  else if (positive_number <= UINT16_MAX)
6998  {
6999  // int 16
7000  v.push_back(0x39);
7001  add_to_vector(v, 2, positive_number);
7002  }
7003  else if (positive_number <= UINT32_MAX)
7004  {
7005  // int 32
7006  v.push_back(0x3a);
7007  add_to_vector(v, 4, positive_number);
7008  }
7009  else
7010  {
7011  // int 64
7012  v.push_back(0x3b);
7013  add_to_vector(v, 8, positive_number);
7014  }
7015  }
7016  break;
7017  }
7018 
7019  case value_t::number_unsigned:
7020  {
7021  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= 0x17)
7022  {
7023  v.push_back(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
7024  }
7025  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= 0xff)
7026  {
7027  v.push_back(0x18);
7028  // one-byte uint8_t
7029  add_to_vector(v, 1, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
7030  }
7031  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= 0xffff)
7032  {
7033  v.push_back(0x19);
7034  // two-byte uint16_t
7035  add_to_vector(v, 2, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
7036  }
7037  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= 0xffffffff)
7038  {
7039  v.push_back(0x1a);
7040  // four-byte uint32_t
7041  add_to_vector(v, 4, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
7042  }
7043  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= 0xffffffffffffffff)
7044  {
7045  v.push_back(0x1b);
7046  // eight-byte uint64_t
7047  add_to_vector(v, 8, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
7048  }
7049  break;
7050  }
7051 
7052  case value_t::number_float:
7053  {
7054  // Double-Precision Float
7055  v.push_back(0xfb);
7056  const auto* helper = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(&(j.m_value.number_float));
7057  for (size_t i = 0; i < 8; ++i)
7058  {
7059  v.push_back(helper[7 - i]);
7060  }
7061  break;
7062  }
7063 
7064  case value_t::string:
7065  {
7066  const auto N = j.m_value.string->size();
7067  if (N <= 0x17)
7068  {
7069  v.push_back(0x60 + N); // 1 byte for string + size
7070  }
7071  else if (N <= 0xff)
7072  {
7073  v.push_back(0x78); // one-byte uint8_t for N
7074  add_to_vector(v, 1, N);
7075  }
7076  else if (N <= 0xffff)
7077  {
7078  v.push_back(0x79); // two-byte uint16_t for N
7079  add_to_vector(v, 2, N);
7080  }
7081  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
7082  {
7083  v.push_back(0x7a); // four-byte uint32_t for N
7084  add_to_vector(v, 4, N);
7085  }
7086  // LCOV_EXCL_START
7087  else if (N <= 0xffffffffffffffff)
7088  {
7089  v.push_back(0x7b); // eight-byte uint64_t for N
7090  add_to_vector(v, 8, N);
7091  }
7092  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
7093 
7094  // append string
7095  std::copy(j.m_value.string->begin(), j.m_value.string->end(),
7096  std::back_inserter(v));
7097  break;
7098  }
7099 
7100  case value_t::array:
7101  {
7102  const auto N = j.m_value.array->size();
7103  if (N <= 0x17)
7104  {
7105  v.push_back(0x80 + N); // 1 byte for array + size
7106  }
7107  else if (N <= 0xff)
7108  {
7109  v.push_back(0x98); // one-byte uint8_t for N
7110  add_to_vector(v, 1, N);
7111  }
7112  else if (N <= 0xffff)
7113  {
7114  v.push_back(0x99); // two-byte uint16_t for N
7115  add_to_vector(v, 2, N);
7116  }
7117  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
7118  {
7119  v.push_back(0x9a); // four-byte uint32_t for N
7120  add_to_vector(v, 4, N);
7121  }
7122  // LCOV_EXCL_START
7123  else if (N <= 0xffffffffffffffff)
7124  {
7125  v.push_back(0x9b); // eight-byte uint64_t for N
7126  add_to_vector(v, 8, N);
7127  }
7128  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
7129 
7130  // append each element
7131  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.array)
7132  {
7133  to_cbor_internal(el, v);
7134  }
7135  break;
7136  }
7137 
7138  case value_t::object:
7139  {
7140  const auto N = j.m_value.object->size();
7141  if (N <= 0x17)
7142  {
7143  v.push_back(0xa0 + N); // 1 byte for object + size
7144  }
7145  else if (N <= 0xff)
7146  {
7147  v.push_back(0xb8);
7148  add_to_vector(v, 1, N); // one-byte uint8_t for N
7149  }
7150  else if (N <= 0xffff)
7151  {
7152  v.push_back(0xb9);
7153  add_to_vector(v, 2, N); // two-byte uint16_t for N
7154  }
7155  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
7156  {
7157  v.push_back(0xba);
7158  add_to_vector(v, 4, N); // four-byte uint32_t for N
7159  }
7160  // LCOV_EXCL_START
7161  else if (N <= 0xffffffffffffffff)
7162  {
7163  v.push_back(0xbb);
7164  add_to_vector(v, 8, N); // eight-byte uint64_t for N
7165  }
7166  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
7167 
7168  // append each element
7169  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.object)
7170  {
7171  to_cbor_internal(el.first, v);
7172  to_cbor_internal(el.second, v);
7173  }
7174  break;
7175  }
7176 
7177  default:
7178  {
7179  break;
7180  }
7181  }
7182  }
7183 
7184 
7185  /*
7186  @brief checks if given lengths do not exceed the size of a given vector
7187 
7188  To secure the access to the byte vector during CBOR/MessagePack
7189  deserialization, bytes are copied from the vector into buffers. This
7190  function checks if the number of bytes to copy (@a len) does not exceed
7191  the size @s size of the vector. Additionally, an @a offset is given from
7192  where to start reading the bytes.
7193 
7194  This function checks whether reading the bytes is safe; that is, offset is
7195  a valid index in the vector, offset+len
7196 
7197  @param[in] size size of the byte vector
7198  @param[in] len number of bytes to read
7199  @param[in] offset offset where to start reading
7200 
7201  vec: x x x x x X X X X X
7202  ^ ^ ^
7203  0 offset len
7204 
7205  @throws out_of_range if `len > v.size()`
7206  */
7207  static void check_length(const size_t size, const size_t len, const size_t offset)
7208  {
7209  // simple case: requested length is greater than the vector's length
7210  if (len > size or offset > size)
7211  {
7212  JSON_THROW(std::out_of_range("len out of range"));
7213  }
7214 
7215  // second case: adding offset would result in overflow
7216  if ((size > (std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max() - offset)))
7217  {
7218  JSON_THROW(std::out_of_range("len+offset out of range"));
7219  }
7220 
7221  // last case: reading past the end of the vector
7222  if (len + offset > size)
7223  {
7224  JSON_THROW(std::out_of_range("len+offset out of range"));
7225  }
7226  }
7227 
7242  static basic_json from_msgpack_internal(const std::vector<uint8_t>& v, size_t& idx)
7243  {
7244  // make sure reading 1 byte is safe
7245  check_length(v.size(), 1, idx);
7246 
7247  // store and increment index
7248  const size_t current_idx = idx++;
7249 
7250  if (v[current_idx] <= 0xbf)
7251  {
7252  if (v[current_idx] <= 0x7f) // positive fixint
7253  {
7254  return v[current_idx];
7255  }
7256  if (v[current_idx] <= 0x8f) // fixmap
7257  {
7258  basic_json result = value_t::object;
7259  const size_t len = v[current_idx] & 0x0f;
7260  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7261  {
7262  std::string key = from_msgpack_internal(v, idx);
7263  result[key] = from_msgpack_internal(v, idx);
7264  }
7265  return result;
7266  }
7267  else if (v[current_idx] <= 0x9f) // fixarray
7268  {
7269  basic_json result = value_t::array;
7270  const size_t len = v[current_idx] & 0x0f;
7271  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7272  {
7273  result.push_back(from_msgpack_internal(v, idx));
7274  }
7275  return result;
7276  }
7277  else // fixstr
7278  {
7279  const size_t len = v[current_idx] & 0x1f;
7280  const size_t offset = current_idx + 1;
7281  idx += len; // skip content bytes
7282  check_length(v.size(), len, offset);
7283  return std::string(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(v.data()) + offset, len);
7284  }
7285  }
7286  else if (v[current_idx] >= 0xe0) // negative fixint
7287  {
7288  return static_cast<int8_t>(v[current_idx]);
7289  }
7290  else
7291  {
7292  switch (v[current_idx])
7293  {
7294  case 0xc0: // nil
7295  {
7296  return value_t::null;
7297  }
7298 
7299  case 0xc2: // false
7300  {
7301  return false;
7302  }
7303 
7304  case 0xc3: // true
7305  {
7306  return true;
7307  }
7308 
7309  case 0xca: // float 32
7310  {
7311  // copy bytes in reverse order into the double variable
7312  float res;
7313  for (size_t byte = 0; byte < sizeof(float); ++byte)
7314  {
7315  reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&res)[sizeof(float) - byte - 1] = v.at(current_idx + 1 + byte);
7316  }
7317  idx += sizeof(float); // skip content bytes
7318  return res;
7319  }
7320 
7321  case 0xcb: // float 64
7322  {
7323  // copy bytes in reverse order into the double variable
7324  double res;
7325  for (size_t byte = 0; byte < sizeof(double); ++byte)
7326  {
7327  reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&res)[sizeof(double) - byte - 1] = v.at(current_idx + 1 + byte);
7328  }
7329  idx += sizeof(double); // skip content bytes
7330  return res;
7331  }
7332 
7333  case 0xcc: // uint 8
7334  {
7335  idx += 1; // skip content byte
7336  return get_from_vector<uint8_t>(v, current_idx);
7337  }
7338 
7339  case 0xcd: // uint 16
7340  {
7341  idx += 2; // skip 2 content bytes
7342  return get_from_vector<uint16_t>(v, current_idx);
7343  }
7344 
7345  case 0xce: // uint 32
7346  {
7347  idx += 4; // skip 4 content bytes
7348  return get_from_vector<uint32_t>(v, current_idx);
7349  }
7350 
7351  case 0xcf: // uint 64
7352  {
7353  idx += 8; // skip 8 content bytes
7354  return get_from_vector<uint64_t>(v, current_idx);
7355  }
7356 
7357  case 0xd0: // int 8
7358  {
7359  idx += 1; // skip content byte
7360  return get_from_vector<int8_t>(v, current_idx);
7361  }
7362 
7363  case 0xd1: // int 16
7364  {
7365  idx += 2; // skip 2 content bytes
7366  return get_from_vector<int16_t>(v, current_idx);
7367  }
7368 
7369  case 0xd2: // int 32
7370  {
7371  idx += 4; // skip 4 content bytes
7372  return get_from_vector<int32_t>(v, current_idx);
7373  }
7374 
7375  case 0xd3: // int 64
7376  {
7377  idx += 8; // skip 8 content bytes
7378  return get_from_vector<int64_t>(v, current_idx);
7379  }
7380 
7381  case 0xd9: // str 8
7382  {
7383  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint8_t>(v, current_idx));
7384  const size_t offset = current_idx + 2;
7385  idx += len + 1; // skip size byte + content bytes
7386  check_length(v.size(), len, offset);
7387  return std::string(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(v.data()) + offset, len);
7388  }
7389 
7390  case 0xda: // str 16
7391  {
7392  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint16_t>(v, current_idx));
7393  const size_t offset = current_idx + 3;
7394  idx += len + 2; // skip 2 size bytes + content bytes
7395  check_length(v.size(), len, offset);
7396  return std::string(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(v.data()) + offset, len);
7397  }
7398 
7399  case 0xdb: // str 32
7400  {
7401  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint32_t>(v, current_idx));
7402  const size_t offset = current_idx + 5;
7403  idx += len + 4; // skip 4 size bytes + content bytes
7404  check_length(v.size(), len, offset);
7405  return std::string(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(v.data()) + offset, len);
7406  }
7407 
7408  case 0xdc: // array 16
7409  {
7410  basic_json result = value_t::array;
7411  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint16_t>(v, current_idx));
7412  idx += 2; // skip 2 size bytes
7413  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7414  {
7415  result.push_back(from_msgpack_internal(v, idx));
7416  }
7417  return result;
7418  }
7419 
7420  case 0xdd: // array 32
7421  {
7422  basic_json result = value_t::array;
7423  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint32_t>(v, current_idx));
7424  idx += 4; // skip 4 size bytes
7425  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7426  {
7427  result.push_back(from_msgpack_internal(v, idx));
7428  }
7429  return result;
7430  }
7431 
7432  case 0xde: // map 16
7433  {
7434  basic_json result = value_t::object;
7435  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint16_t>(v, current_idx));
7436  idx += 2; // skip 2 size bytes
7437  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7438  {
7439  std::string key = from_msgpack_internal(v, idx);
7440  result[key] = from_msgpack_internal(v, idx);
7441  }
7442  return result;
7443  }
7444 
7445  case 0xdf: // map 32
7446  {
7447  basic_json result = value_t::object;
7448  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint32_t>(v, current_idx));
7449  idx += 4; // skip 4 size bytes
7450  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7451  {
7452  std::string key = from_msgpack_internal(v, idx);
7453  result[key] = from_msgpack_internal(v, idx);
7454  }
7455  return result;
7456  }
7457 
7458  default:
7459  {
7460  JSON_THROW(std::invalid_argument("error parsing a msgpack @ " + std::to_string(current_idx) + ": " + std::to_string(static_cast<int>(v[current_idx]))));
7461  }
7462  }
7463  }
7464  }
7465 
7480  static basic_json from_cbor_internal(const std::vector<uint8_t>& v, size_t& idx)
7481  {
7482  // store and increment index
7483  const size_t current_idx = idx++;
7484 
7485  switch (v.at(current_idx))
7486  {
7487  // Integer 0x00..0x17 (0..23)
7488  case 0x00:
7489  case 0x01:
7490  case 0x02:
7491  case 0x03:
7492  case 0x04:
7493  case 0x05:
7494  case 0x06:
7495  case 0x07:
7496  case 0x08:
7497  case 0x09:
7498  case 0x0a:
7499  case 0x0b:
7500  case 0x0c:
7501  case 0x0d:
7502  case 0x0e:
7503  case 0x0f:
7504  case 0x10:
7505  case 0x11:
7506  case 0x12:
7507  case 0x13:
7508  case 0x14:
7509  case 0x15:
7510  case 0x16:
7511  case 0x17:
7512  {
7513  return v[current_idx];
7514  }
7515 
7516  case 0x18: // Unsigned integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
7517  {
7518  idx += 1; // skip content byte
7519  return get_from_vector<uint8_t>(v, current_idx);
7520  }
7521 
7522  case 0x19: // Unsigned integer (two-byte uint16_t follows)
7523  {
7524  idx += 2; // skip 2 content bytes
7525  return get_from_vector<uint16_t>(v, current_idx);
7526  }
7527 
7528  case 0x1a: // Unsigned integer (four-byte uint32_t follows)
7529  {
7530  idx += 4; // skip 4 content bytes
7531  return get_from_vector<uint32_t>(v, current_idx);
7532  }
7533 
7534  case 0x1b: // Unsigned integer (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
7535  {
7536  idx += 8; // skip 8 content bytes
7537  return get_from_vector<uint64_t>(v, current_idx);
7538  }
7539 
7540  // Negative integer -1-0x00..-1-0x17 (-1..-24)
7541  case 0x20:
7542  case 0x21:
7543  case 0x22:
7544  case 0x23:
7545  case 0x24:
7546  case 0x25:
7547  case 0x26:
7548  case 0x27:
7549  case 0x28:
7550  case 0x29:
7551  case 0x2a:
7552  case 0x2b:
7553  case 0x2c:
7554  case 0x2d:
7555  case 0x2e:
7556  case 0x2f:
7557  case 0x30:
7558  case 0x31:
7559  case 0x32:
7560  case 0x33:
7561  case 0x34:
7562  case 0x35:
7563  case 0x36:
7564  case 0x37:
7565  {
7566  return static_cast<int8_t>(0x20 - 1 - v[current_idx]);
7567  }
7568 
7569  case 0x38: // Negative integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
7570  {
7571  idx += 1; // skip content byte
7572  // must be uint8_t !
7573  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_from_vector<uint8_t>(v, current_idx);
7574  }
7575 
7576  case 0x39: // Negative integer -1-n (two-byte uint16_t follows)
7577  {
7578  idx += 2; // skip 2 content bytes
7579  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_from_vector<uint16_t>(v, current_idx);
7580  }
7581 
7582  case 0x3a: // Negative integer -1-n (four-byte uint32_t follows)
7583  {
7584  idx += 4; // skip 4 content bytes
7585  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_from_vector<uint32_t>(v, current_idx);
7586  }
7587 
7588  case 0x3b: // Negative integer -1-n (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
7589  {
7590  idx += 8; // skip 8 content bytes
7591  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - static_cast<number_integer_t>(get_from_vector<uint64_t>(v, current_idx));
7592  }
7593 
7594  // UTF-8 string (0x00..0x17 bytes follow)
7595  case 0x60:
7596  case 0x61:
7597  case 0x62:
7598  case 0x63:
7599  case 0x64:
7600  case 0x65:
7601  case 0x66:
7602  case 0x67:
7603  case 0x68:
7604  case 0x69:
7605  case 0x6a:
7606  case 0x6b:
7607  case 0x6c:
7608  case 0x6d:
7609  case 0x6e:
7610  case 0x6f:
7611  case 0x70:
7612  case 0x71:
7613  case 0x72:
7614  case 0x73:
7615  case 0x74:
7616  case 0x75:
7617  case 0x76:
7618  case 0x77:
7619  {
7620  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(v[current_idx] - 0x60);
7621  const size_t offset = current_idx + 1;
7622  idx += len; // skip content bytes
7623  check_length(v.size(), len, offset);
7624  return std::string(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(v.data()) + offset, len);
7625  }
7626 
7627  case 0x78: // UTF-8 string (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
7628  {
7629  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint8_t>(v, current_idx));
7630  const size_t offset = current_idx + 2;
7631  idx += len + 1; // skip size byte + content bytes
7632  check_length(v.size(), len, offset);
7633  return std::string(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(v.data()) + offset, len);
7634  }
7635 
7636  case 0x79: // UTF-8 string (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
7637  {
7638  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint16_t>(v, current_idx));
7639  const size_t offset = current_idx + 3;
7640  idx += len + 2; // skip 2 size bytes + content bytes
7641  check_length(v.size(), len, offset);
7642  return std::string(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(v.data()) + offset, len);
7643  }
7644 
7645  case 0x7a: // UTF-8 string (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
7646  {
7647  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint32_t>(v, current_idx));
7648  const size_t offset = current_idx + 5;
7649  idx += len + 4; // skip 4 size bytes + content bytes
7650  check_length(v.size(), len, offset);
7651  return std::string(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(v.data()) + offset, len);
7652  }
7653 
7654  case 0x7b: // UTF-8 string (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
7655  {
7656  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint64_t>(v, current_idx));
7657  const size_t offset = current_idx + 9;
7658  idx += len + 8; // skip 8 size bytes + content bytes
7659  check_length(v.size(), len, offset);
7660  return std::string(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(v.data()) + offset, len);
7661  }
7662 
7663  case 0x7f: // UTF-8 string (indefinite length)
7664  {
7665  std::string result;
7666  while (v.at(idx) != 0xff)
7667  {
7668  string_t s = from_cbor_internal(v, idx);
7669  result += s;
7670  }
7671  // skip break byte (0xFF)
7672  idx += 1;
7673  return result;
7674  }
7675 
7676  // array (0x00..0x17 data items follow)
7677  case 0x80:
7678  case 0x81:
7679  case 0x82:
7680  case 0x83:
7681  case 0x84:
7682  case 0x85:
7683  case 0x86:
7684  case 0x87:
7685  case 0x88:
7686  case 0x89:
7687  case 0x8a:
7688  case 0x8b:
7689  case 0x8c:
7690  case 0x8d:
7691  case 0x8e:
7692  case 0x8f:
7693  case 0x90:
7694  case 0x91:
7695  case 0x92:
7696  case 0x93:
7697  case 0x94:
7698  case 0x95:
7699  case 0x96:
7700  case 0x97:
7701  {
7702  basic_json result = value_t::array;
7703  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(v[current_idx] - 0x80);
7704  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7705  {
7706  result.push_back(from_cbor_internal(v, idx));
7707  }
7708  return result;
7709  }
7710 
7711  case 0x98: // array (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
7712  {
7713  basic_json result = value_t::array;
7714  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint8_t>(v, current_idx));
7715  idx += 1; // skip 1 size byte
7716  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7717  {
7718  result.push_back(from_cbor_internal(v, idx));
7719  }
7720  return result;
7721  }
7722 
7723  case 0x99: // array (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
7724  {
7725  basic_json result = value_t::array;
7726  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint16_t>(v, current_idx));
7727  idx += 2; // skip 4 size bytes
7728  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7729  {
7730  result.push_back(from_cbor_internal(v, idx));
7731  }
7732  return result;
7733  }
7734 
7735  case 0x9a: // array (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
7736  {
7737  basic_json result = value_t::array;
7738  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint32_t>(v, current_idx));
7739  idx += 4; // skip 4 size bytes
7740  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7741  {
7742  result.push_back(from_cbor_internal(v, idx));
7743  }
7744  return result;
7745  }
7746 
7747  case 0x9b: // array (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
7748  {
7749  basic_json result = value_t::array;
7750  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint64_t>(v, current_idx));
7751  idx += 8; // skip 8 size bytes
7752  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7753  {
7754  result.push_back(from_cbor_internal(v, idx));
7755  }
7756  return result;
7757  }
7758 
7759  case 0x9f: // array (indefinite length)
7760  {
7761  basic_json result = value_t::array;
7762  while (v.at(idx) != 0xff)
7763  {
7764  result.push_back(from_cbor_internal(v, idx));
7765  }
7766  // skip break byte (0xFF)
7767  idx += 1;
7768  return result;
7769  }
7770 
7771  // map (0x00..0x17 pairs of data items follow)
7772  case 0xa0:
7773  case 0xa1:
7774  case 0xa2:
7775  case 0xa3:
7776  case 0xa4:
7777  case 0xa5:
7778  case 0xa6:
7779  case 0xa7:
7780  case 0xa8:
7781  case 0xa9:
7782  case 0xaa:
7783  case 0xab:
7784  case 0xac:
7785  case 0xad:
7786  case 0xae:
7787  case 0xaf:
7788  case 0xb0:
7789  case 0xb1:
7790  case 0xb2:
7791  case 0xb3:
7792  case 0xb4:
7793  case 0xb5:
7794  case 0xb6:
7795  case 0xb7:
7796  {
7797  basic_json result = value_t::object;
7798  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(v[current_idx] - 0xa0);
7799  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7800  {
7801  std::string key = from_cbor_internal(v, idx);
7802  result[key] = from_cbor_internal(v, idx);
7803  }
7804  return result;
7805  }
7806 
7807  case 0xb8: // map (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
7808  {
7809  basic_json result = value_t::object;
7810  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint8_t>(v, current_idx));
7811  idx += 1; // skip 1 size byte
7812  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7813  {
7814  std::string key = from_cbor_internal(v, idx);
7815  result[key] = from_cbor_internal(v, idx);
7816  }
7817  return result;
7818  }
7819 
7820  case 0xb9: // map (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
7821  {
7822  basic_json result = value_t::object;
7823  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint16_t>(v, current_idx));
7824  idx += 2; // skip 2 size bytes
7825  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7826  {
7827  std::string key = from_cbor_internal(v, idx);
7828  result[key] = from_cbor_internal(v, idx);
7829  }
7830  return result;
7831  }
7832 
7833  case 0xba: // map (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
7834  {
7835  basic_json result = value_t::object;
7836  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint32_t>(v, current_idx));
7837  idx += 4; // skip 4 size bytes
7838  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7839  {
7840  std::string key = from_cbor_internal(v, idx);
7841  result[key] = from_cbor_internal(v, idx);
7842  }
7843  return result;
7844  }
7845 
7846  case 0xbb: // map (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
7847  {
7848  basic_json result = value_t::object;
7849  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_from_vector<uint64_t>(v, current_idx));
7850  idx += 8; // skip 8 size bytes
7851  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7852  {
7853  std::string key = from_cbor_internal(v, idx);
7854  result[key] = from_cbor_internal(v, idx);
7855  }
7856  return result;
7857  }
7858 
7859  case 0xbf: // map (indefinite length)
7860  {
7861  basic_json result = value_t::object;
7862  while (v.at(idx) != 0xff)
7863  {
7864  std::string key = from_cbor_internal(v, idx);
7865  result[key] = from_cbor_internal(v, idx);
7866  }
7867  // skip break byte (0xFF)
7868  idx += 1;
7869  return result;
7870  }
7871 
7872  case 0xf4: // false
7873  {
7874  return false;
7875  }
7876 
7877  case 0xf5: // true
7878  {
7879  return true;
7880  }
7881 
7882  case 0xf6: // null
7883  {
7884  return value_t::null;
7885  }
7886 
7887  case 0xf9: // Half-Precision Float (two-byte IEEE 754)
7888  {
7889  idx += 2; // skip two content bytes
7890 
7891  // code from RFC 7049, Appendix D, Figure 3:
7892  // As half-precision floating-point numbers were only added to
7893  // IEEE 754 in 2008, today's programming platforms often still
7894  // only have limited support for them. It is very easy to
7895  // include at least decoding support for them even without such
7896  // support. An example of a small decoder for half-precision
7897  // floating-point numbers in the C language is shown in Fig. 3.
7898  const int half = (v.at(current_idx + 1) << 8) + v.at(current_idx + 2);
7899  const int exp = (half >> 10) & 0x1f;
7900  const int mant = half & 0x3ff;
7901  double val;
7902  if (exp == 0)
7903  {
7904  val = std::ldexp(mant, -24);
7905  }
7906  else if (exp != 31)
7907  {
7908  val = std::ldexp(mant + 1024, exp - 25);
7909  }
7910  else
7911  {
7912  val = mant == 0 ? INFINITY : NAN;
7913  }
7914  return (half & 0x8000) != 0 ? -val : val;
7915  }
7916 
7917  case 0xfa: // Single-Precision Float (four-byte IEEE 754)
7918  {
7919  // copy bytes in reverse order into the float variable
7920  float res;
7921  for (size_t byte = 0; byte < sizeof(float); ++byte)
7922  {
7923  reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&res)[sizeof(float) - byte - 1] = v.at(current_idx + 1 + byte);
7924  }
7925  idx += sizeof(float); // skip content bytes
7926  return res;
7927  }
7928 
7929  case 0xfb: // Double-Precision Float (eight-byte IEEE 754)
7930  {
7931  // copy bytes in reverse order into the double variable
7932  double res;
7933  for (size_t byte = 0; byte < sizeof(double); ++byte)
7934  {
7935  reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&res)[sizeof(double) - byte - 1] = v.at(current_idx + 1 + byte);
7936  }
7937  idx += sizeof(double); // skip content bytes
7938  return res;
7939  }
7940 
7941  default: // anything else (0xFF is handled inside the other types)
7942  {
7943  JSON_THROW(std::invalid_argument("error parsing a CBOR @ " + std::to_string(current_idx) + ": " + std::to_string(static_cast<int>(v[current_idx]))));
7944  }
7945  }
7946  }
7947 
7948  public:
7969  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_msgpack(const basic_json& j)
7970  {
7971  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
7972  to_msgpack_internal(j, result);
7973  return result;
7974  }
7975 
7998  static basic_json from_msgpack(const std::vector<uint8_t>& v)
7999  {
8000  size_t i = 0;
8001  return from_msgpack_internal(v, i);
8002  }
8003 
8025  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_cbor(const basic_json& j)
8026  {
8027  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
8028  to_cbor_internal(j, result);
8029  return result;
8030  }
8031 
8055  static basic_json from_cbor(const std::vector<uint8_t>& v)
8056  {
8057  size_t i = 0;
8058  return from_cbor_internal(v, i);
8059  }

8082  std::string type_name() const
8083  {

8085  switch (m_type)
8086  {
8087  case value_t::null:
8088  return "null";
8089  case value_t::object:
8090  return "object";
8091  case value_t::array:
8092  return "array";
8093  case value_t::string:
8094  return "string";
8095  case value_t::boolean:
8096  return "boolean";
8097  case value_t::discarded:

8099  default:
8100  return "number";
8101  }
8102  }
8103  }
8104 
8105  private:
8114  static std::size_t extra_space(const string_t& s) noexcept
8115  {
8116  return std::accumulate(s.begin(), s.end(), size_t{},
8117  [](size_t res, typename string_t::value_type c)
8118  {
8119  switch (c)
8120  {
8121  case '"':
8122  case '\\':
8123  case '\b':
8124  case '\f':
8125  case '\n':
8126  case '\r':
8127  case '\t':
8128  {
8129  // from c (1 byte) to \x (2 bytes)
8130  return res + 1;
8131  }
8132 
8133  default:
8134  {
8135  if (c >= 0x00 and c <= 0x1f)
8136  {
8137  // from c (1 byte) to \uxxxx (6 bytes)
8138  return res + 5;
8139  }
8140 
8141  return res;
8142  }
8143  }
8144  });
8145  }
8146 
8160  static string_t escape_string(const string_t& s)
8161  {
8162  const auto space = extra_space(s);
8163  if (space == 0)
8164  {
8165  return s;
8166  }
8167 
8168  // create a result string of necessary size
8169  string_t result(s.size() + space, '\\');
8170  std::size_t pos = 0;
8171 
8172  for (const auto& c : s)
8173  {
8174  switch (c)
8175  {
8176  // quotation mark (0x22)
8177  case '"':
8178  {
8179  result[pos + 1] = '"';
8180  pos += 2;
8181  break;
8182  }
8183 
8184  // reverse solidus (0x5c)
8185  case '\\':
8186  {
8187  // nothing to change
8188  pos += 2;
8189  break;
8190  }
8191 
8192  // backspace (0x08)
8193  case '\b':
8194  {
8195  result[pos + 1] = 'b';
8196  pos += 2;
8197  break;
8198  }
8199 
8200  // formfeed (0x0c)
8201  case '\f':
8202  {
8203  result[pos + 1] = 'f';
8204  pos += 2;
8205  break;
8206  }
8207 
8208  // newline (0x0a)
8209  case '\n':
8210  {
8211  result[pos + 1] = 'n';
8212  pos += 2;
8213  break;
8214  }
8215 
8216  // carriage return (0x0d)
8217  case '\r':
8218  {
8219  result[pos + 1] = 'r';
8220  pos += 2;
8221  break;
8222  }
8223 
8224  // horizontal tab (0x09)
8225  case '\t':
8226  {
8227  result[pos + 1] = 't';
8228  pos += 2;
8229  break;
8230  }
8231 
8232  default:
8233  {
8234  if (c >= 0x00 and c <= 0x1f)
8235  {
8236  // convert a number 0..15 to its hex representation
8237  // (0..f)
8238  static const char hexify[16] =
8239  {
8240  '0', '1', '2', '3', '4', '5', '6', '7',
8241  '8', '9', 'a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f'
8242  };
8243 
8244  // print character c as \uxxxx
8245  for (const char m :
8246  { 'u', '0', '0', hexify[c >> 4], hexify[c & 0x0f]
8247  })
8248  {
8249  result[++pos] = m;
8250  }
8251 
8252  ++pos;
8253  }
8254  else
8255  {
8256  // all other characters are added as-is
8257  result[pos++] = c;
8258  }
8259  break;
8260  }
8261  }
8262  }
8263 
8264  return result;
8265  }
8266 
8284  void dump(std::ostream& o,
8285  const bool pretty_print,
8286  const unsigned int indent_step,
8287  const unsigned int current_indent = 0) const
8288  {
8289  // variable to hold indentation for recursive calls
8290  unsigned int new_indent = current_indent;
8291 
8292  switch (m_type)
8293  {
8294  case value_t::object:
8295  {
8296  if (m_value.object->empty())
8297  {
8298  o << "{}";
8299  return;
8300  }
8301 
8302  o << "{";
8303 
8304  // increase indentation
8305  if (pretty_print)
8306  {
8307  new_indent += indent_step;
8308  o << "\n";
8309  }
8310 
8311  for (auto i = m_value.object->cbegin(); i != m_value.object->cend(); ++i)
8312  {
8313  if (i != m_value.object->cbegin())
8314  {
8315  o << (pretty_print ? ",\n" : ",");
8316  }
8317  o << string_t(new_indent, ' ') << "\""
8318  << escape_string(i->first) << "\":"
8319  << (pretty_print ? " " : "");
8320  i->second.dump(o, pretty_print, indent_step, new_indent);
8321  }
8322 
8323  // decrease indentation
8324  if (pretty_print)
8325  {
8326  new_indent -= indent_step;
8327  o << "\n";
8328  }
8329 
8330  o << string_t(new_indent, ' ') + "}";
8331  return;
8332  }
8333 
8334  case value_t::array:
8335  {
8336  if (m_value.array->empty())
8337  {
8338  o << "[]";
8339  return;
8340  }
8341 
8342  o << "[";
8343 
8344  // increase indentation
8345  if (pretty_print)
8346  {
8347  new_indent += indent_step;
8348  o << "\n";
8349  }
8350 
8351  for (auto i = m_value.array->cbegin(); i != m_value.array->cend(); ++i)
8352  {
8353  if (i != m_value.array->cbegin())
8354  {
8355  o << (pretty_print ? ",\n" : ",");
8356  }
8357  o << string_t(new_indent, ' ');
8358  i->dump(o, pretty_print, indent_step, new_indent);
8359  }
8360 
8361  // decrease indentation
8362  if (pretty_print)
8363  {
8364  new_indent -= indent_step;
8365  o << "\n";
8366  }
8367 
8368  o << string_t(new_indent, ' ') << "]";
8369  return;
8370  }
8371 
8372  case value_t::string:
8373  {
8374  o << string_t("\"") << escape_string(*m_value.string) << "\"";
8375  return;
8376  }
8377 
8378  case value_t::boolean:
8379  {
8380  o << (m_value.boolean ? "true" : "false");
8381  return;
8382  }
8383 
8384  case value_t::number_integer:
8385  {
8386  o << m_value.number_integer;
8387  return;
8388  }
8389 
8390  case value_t::number_unsigned:
8391  {
8392  o << m_value.number_unsigned;
8393  return;
8394  }
8395 
8396  case value_t::number_float:
8397  {
8398  if (m_value.number_float == 0)
8399  {
8400  // special case for zero to get "0.0"/"-0.0"
8401  o << (std::signbit(m_value.number_float) ? "-0.0" : "0.0");
8402  }
8403  else
8404  {
8405  o << m_value.number_float;
8406  }
8407  return;
8408  }
8409 
8410  case value_t::discarded:
8411  {
8412  o << "<discarded>";
8413  return;
8414  }
8415 
8416  case value_t::null:
8417  {
8418  o << "null";
8419  return;
8420  }
8421  }
8422  }
8423 
8424  private:
8426  // member variables //
8428 
8430  value_t m_type = value_t::null;
8431 
8433  json_value m_value = {};
8434

8438  // iterators //
8440 
8450  class primitive_iterator_t
8451  {
8452  public:
8453 
8454  difference_type get_value() const noexcept
8455  {
8456  return m_it;
8457  }
8459  void set_begin() noexcept
8460  {
8461  m_it = begin_value;
8462  }
8463 
8465  void set_end() noexcept
8466  {
8467  m_it = end_value;
8468  }
8469 
8471  constexpr bool is_begin() const noexcept
8472  {
8473  return (m_it == begin_value);
8474  }
8475 
8477  constexpr bool is_end() const noexcept
8478  {
8479  return (m_it == end_value);
8480  }
8481 
8482  friend constexpr bool operator==(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
8483  {
8484  return lhs.m_it == rhs.m_it;
8485  }
8486 
8487  friend constexpr bool operator!=(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
8488  {
8489  return !(lhs == rhs);
8490  }
8491 
8492  friend constexpr bool operator<(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
8493  {
8494  return lhs.m_it < rhs.m_it;
8495  }
8496 
8497  friend constexpr bool operator<=(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
8498  {
8499  return lhs.m_it <= rhs.m_it;
8500  }
8501 
8502  friend constexpr bool operator>(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
8503  {
8504  return lhs.m_it > rhs.m_it;
8505  }
8506 
8507  friend constexpr bool operator>=(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
8508  {
8509  return lhs.m_it >= rhs.m_it;
8510  }
8511 
8512  primitive_iterator_t operator+(difference_type i)
8513  {
8514  auto result = *this;
8515  result += i;
8516  return result;
8517  }
8518 
8519  friend constexpr difference_type operator-(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
8520  {
8521  return lhs.m_it - rhs.m_it;
8522  }
8523 
8524  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, primitive_iterator_t it)
8525  {
8526  return os << it.m_it;
8527  }

8530  {
8531  ++m_it;
8532  return *this;
8533  }

8536  {

8538  m_it++;
8539  return result;
8540  }

8546  }

8553  }

8567  private:
8568  static constexpr difference_type begin_value = 0;
8569  static constexpr difference_type end_value = begin_value + 1;
8570 
8572  difference_type m_it = std::numeric_limits<std::ptrdiff_t>::denorm_min();
8573  };

8582  struct internal_iterator
8583  {
8585  typename object_t::iterator object_iterator;
8587  typename array_t::iterator array_iterator;
8589  primitive_iterator_t primitive_iterator;
8590 
8592  internal_iterator() noexcept
8593  : object_iterator(), array_iterator(), primitive_iterator()
8594  {}
8595  };
8596 
8598  template<typename IteratorType>
8599  class iteration_proxy
8600  {
8601  private:
8603  class iteration_proxy_internal
8604  {
8605  private:
8607  IteratorType anchor;
8609  size_t array_index = 0;
8610 
8611  public:
8612  explicit iteration_proxy_internal(IteratorType it) noexcept
8613  : anchor(it)
8614  {}
8615 
8617  iteration_proxy_internal& operator*()
8618  {
8619  return *this;
8620  }
8621 
8623  iteration_proxy_internal& operator++()
8624  {
8625  ++anchor;
8626  ++array_index;
8627 
8628  return *this;
8629  }
8630 
8632  bool operator!= (const iteration_proxy_internal& o) const
8633  {
8634  return anchor != o.anchor;
8635  }
8636 
8638  typename basic_json::string_t key() const
8639  {
8640  assert(anchor.m_object != nullptr);
8641 
8642  switch (anchor.m_object->type())
8643  {
8644  // use integer array index as key
8645  case value_t::array:
8646  {
8647  return std::to_string(array_index);
8648  }
8649 
8650  // use key from the object
8651  case value_t::object:
8652  {
8653  return anchor.key();
8654  }
8655 
8656  // use an empty key for all primitive types
8657  default:
8658  {
8659  return "";
8660  }
8661  }
8662  }
8663 
8665  typename IteratorType::reference value() const
8666  {
8667  return anchor.value();
8668  }
8669  };
8670 
8672  typename IteratorType::reference container;
8673 
8674  public:
8676  explicit iteration_proxy(typename IteratorType::reference cont)
8677  : container(cont)
8678  {}
8679 
8681  iteration_proxy_internal begin() noexcept
8682  {
8683  return iteration_proxy_internal(container.begin());
8684  }
8685 
8687  iteration_proxy_internal end() noexcept
8688  {
8689  return iteration_proxy_internal(container.end());
8690  }
8691  };

8713  template<typename U>
8714  class iter_impl : public std::iterator<std::random_access_iterator_tag, U>
8715  {
8717  friend class basic_json;
8718 
8719  // make sure U is basic_json or const basic_json
8720  static_assert(std::is_same<U, basic_json>::value
8721  or std::is_same<U, const basic_json>::value,
8722  "iter_impl only accepts (const) basic_json");
8723 
8724  public:
8726  using value_type = typename basic_json::value_type;
8728  using difference_type = typename basic_json::difference_type;
8730  using pointer = typename std::conditional<std::is_const<U>::value,
8731  typename basic_json::const_pointer,
8732  typename basic_json::pointer>::type;
8734  using reference = typename std::conditional<std::is_const<U>::value,
8735  typename basic_json::const_reference,
8736  typename basic_json::reference>::type;

8739 
8741  iter_impl() = default;
8742 
8749  explicit iter_impl(pointer object) noexcept
8750  : m_object(object)
8751  {

8753 
8754  switch (m_object->m_type)
8755  {
8756  case basic_json::value_t::object:
8757  {
8758  m_it.object_iterator = typename object_t::iterator();
8759  break;
8760  }
8761 
8762  case basic_json::value_t::array:
8763  {
8764  m_it.array_iterator = typename array_t::iterator();
8765  break;
8766  }
8767 
8768  default:
8769  {
8770  m_it.primitive_iterator = primitive_iterator_t();
8771  break;
8772  }
8773  }
8774  }
8775 
8776  /*
8777  Use operator `const_iterator` instead of `const_iterator(const iterator&
8778  other) noexcept` to avoid two class definitions for @ref iterator and
8779  @ref const_iterator.
8780 
8781  This function is only called if this class is an @ref iterator. If this
8782  class is a @ref const_iterator this function is not called.
8783  */
8784  operator const_iterator() const
8785  {

8787 
8788  if (m_object)
8789  {
8790  ret.m_object = m_object;
8791  ret.m_it = m_it;
8792  }
8793 
8794  return ret;
8795  }

8922  {

8925 
8926  JSON_THROW(std::out_of_range("cannot get value"));
8927  }

9055  bool operator==(const iter_impl& other) const
9056  {
9057  // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
9058  if (m_object != other.m_object)
9059  {
9060  JSON_THROW(std::domain_error("cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
9061  }
9062 
9063  assert(m_object != nullptr);
9064 
9065  switch (m_object->m_type)
9066  {
9067  case basic_json::value_t::object:
9068  {
9069  return (m_it.object_iterator == other.m_it.object_iterator);
9070  }
9071 
9072  case basic_json::value_t::array:
9073  {
9074  return (m_it.array_iterator == other.m_it.array_iterator);
9075  }
9076 
9077  default:
9078  {
9079  return (m_it.primitive_iterator == other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
9080  }
9081  }
9082  }

9089  {
9090  return not operator==(other);
9091  }

9098  {
9099  // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
9100  if (m_object != other.m_object)
9101  {
9102  JSON_THROW(std::domain_error("cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
9103  }
9104 
9105  assert(m_object != nullptr);
9106 
9107  switch (m_object->m_type)
9108  {

9110  {
9111  JSON_THROW(std::domain_error("cannot compare order of object iterators"));
9112  }
9113 
9114  case basic_json::value_t::array:
9115  {
9116  return (m_it.array_iterator < other.m_it.array_iterator);
9117  }
9118 
9119  default:
9120  {
9121  return (m_it.primitive_iterator < other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
9122  }
9123  }
9124  }

9459  using lexer_char_t = unsigned char;

9471  explicit lexer(std::istream& s)
9472  : m_stream(&s), m_line_buffer()
9473  {
9474  // immediately abort if stream is erroneous
9475  if (s.fail())
9476  {
9477  JSON_THROW(std::invalid_argument("stream error"));
9478  }
9479 
9480  // fill buffer
9481  fill_line_buffer();
9482 
9483  // skip UTF-8 byte-order mark
9484  if (m_line_buffer.size() >= 3 and m_line_buffer.substr(0, 3) == "\xEF\xBB\xBF")
9485  {
9486  m_line_buffer[0] = ' ';
9487  m_line_buffer[1] = ' ';
9488  m_line_buffer[2] = ' ';
9489  }
9490  }
9491 
9492  // switch off unwanted functions (due to pointer members)
9493  lexer() = delete;
9494  lexer(const lexer&) = delete;
9495  lexer operator=(const lexer&) = delete;
9496 
9520  static string_t to_unicode(const std::size_t codepoint1,
9521  const std::size_t codepoint2 = 0)
9522  {
9523  // calculate the code point from the given code points
9524  std::size_t codepoint = codepoint1;
9525 
9526  // check if codepoint1 is a high surrogate
9527  if (codepoint1 >= 0xD800 and codepoint1 <= 0xDBFF)
9528  {
9529  // check if codepoint2 is a low surrogate
9530  if (codepoint2 >= 0xDC00 and codepoint2 <= 0xDFFF)
9531  {
9532  codepoint =
9533  // high surrogate occupies the most significant 22 bits
9534  (codepoint1 << 10)
9535  // low surrogate occupies the least significant 15 bits
9536  + codepoint2
9537  // there is still the 0xD800, 0xDC00 and 0x10000 noise
9538  // in the result so we have to subtract with:
9539  // (0xD800 << 10) + DC00 - 0x10000 = 0x35FDC00
9540  - 0x35FDC00;
9541  }
9542  else
9543  {
9544  JSON_THROW(std::invalid_argument("missing or wrong low surrogate"));
9545  }
9546  }
9547 
9548  string_t result;
9549 
9550  if (codepoint < 0x80)
9551  {
9552  // 1-byte characters: 0xxxxxxx (ASCII)
9553  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(codepoint));
9554  }
9555  else if (codepoint <= 0x7ff)
9556  {
9557  // 2-byte characters: 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
9558  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0xC0 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x1F)));
9559  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F)));
9560  }
9561  else if (codepoint <= 0xffff)
9562  {
9563  // 3-byte characters: 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
9564  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0xE0 | ((codepoint >> 12) & 0x0F)));
9565  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F)));
9566  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F)));
9567  }
9568  else if (codepoint <= 0x10ffff)
9569  {
9570  // 4-byte characters: 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
9571  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0xF0 | ((codepoint >> 18) & 0x07)));
9572  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 12) & 0x3F)));
9573  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F)));
9574  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F)));
9575  }
9576  else
9577  {
9578  JSON_THROW(std::out_of_range("code points above 0x10FFFF are invalid"));
9579  }
9580 
9581  return result;
9582  }
9583 
9585  static std::string token_type_name(const token_type t)
9586  {
9587  switch (t)
9588  {
9589  case token_type::uninitialized:
9590  return "<uninitialized>";
9591  case token_type::literal_true:
9592  return "true literal";
9593  case token_type::literal_false:
9594  return "false literal";
9595  case token_type::literal_null:
9596  return "null literal";
9597  case token_type::value_string:
9598  return "string literal";
9599  case token_type::value_number:
9600  return "number literal";
9601  case token_type::begin_array:
9602  return "'['";
9603  case token_type::begin_object:
9604  return "'{'";
9605  case token_type::end_array:
9606  return "']'";
9607  case token_type::end_object:
9608  return "'}'";
9609  case token_type::name_separator:
9610  return "':'";
9611  case token_type::value_separator:
9612  return "','";
9613  case token_type::parse_error:
9614  return "<parse error>";
9615  case token_type::end_of_input:
9616  return "end of input";
9617  default:
9618  {
9619  // catch non-enum values
9620  return "unknown token"; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
9621  }
9622  }
9623  }

10384  goto basic_json_parser_44;
10385  }
10386  goto basic_json_parser_14;
10387  }
10388 basic_json_parser_51:

10390  if (yych <= '/')
10391  {
10392  goto basic_json_parser_32;
10393  }
10394  if (yych >= ':')
10395  {
10396  goto basic_json_parser_32;
10397  }
10398 basic_json_parser_52:
10399  ++m_cursor;
10400  if (m_limit <= m_cursor)
10401  {
10402  fill_line_buffer(1); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
10403  }
10404  yych = *m_cursor;
10405  if (yych <= '/')
10406  {
10407  goto basic_json_parser_14;
10408  }
10409  if (yych <= '9')
10410  {

10412  }

10443  {

10445  {

10453  }

10457  {

10459  }
10460  if (yych <= '`')
10461  {

10463  }

10465  {

10467  }
